At least three players should be all but certain to go.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109","content":"Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players - Samuel Luckhurst - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players
=================================================================================

Conclusions can be made on a host of necessary outgoings at Man United next year. At least three players should be all but certain to go.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   06:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Amorim needs a consistent scorer like Gyokeres](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30446291.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2176489471.jpg)

Amorim needs a consistent scorer like Gyokeres

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Money is so tight at Manchester United when Erik ten Hag wanted to revert to overnight stays at a nearby hotel before home games last season, he was informed the money was not there.

United restored a players' lounge at Old Trafford at the start of last season at Ten Hag's request. That no imagery of the pre-match hub has ever been published tells its own story.

Ten Hag ended United's seasonal stays at The Lowry Hotel in 2022 but he felt he could exert greater control and foster better team-bonding back at the city centre hotel, with the Hyatt Regency a possible alternative. Ten Hag was overruled.

So the prospect of United spending in the January transfer window is currently remote. They have a 28-man squad and are doubled up in every position. Triple in some. United have six senior centre backs on their books and Leny Yoro has still not had a competitive kick.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

If Ruben Amorim is to have any backing in the mid-season market, United have to sell to buy. Or loan. No club worth their salt is going to part with cash for Antony (one start all season - against League One Barnsley) or Joshua Zirkzee (one goal in 18 games). United could not even obtain a decent fee from a Saudi Pro League club when Al Nassr took Alex Telles off their hands.

Senior figures at United privately feel Zirkzee is a lost cause. United will need a proven goalscorer next year and someone has to make way.

There is that scene in _Moneyball_ where Brad Pitt and Jonah Hill discuss cutting a player. "They're professional ball players, be straight with them. No fluff, just facts," Pitt says. "Would you rather get a bullet to the head or five to the chest and bleed to death?" Watching Zirkzee on Sunday, his United career is becoming death by a thousand cuts. United have to cut him loose.

Amorim actually had to tell Zirkzee, purportedly a striker, to get into the box in the 93rd minute. "At the end of the game we are around the box with two strikers, Josh has to understand that he has to go into the box for the crosses," Amorim bluntly said.

It was easy to surmise Amorim would not be content with Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund as his striker options. Then he benched the £108.5million duo at Ipswich.

United are the punchline again. Norway and Sweden produce brilliant forwards in Erling Haaland, Alexander Isak and Viktor Gyokeres. Which one do United sign? The Danish one. For £72m.

  

![Image 4: £108.5m down the drain? Will Hojlund or Zirkzee score again?](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30291397.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2181992216.jpg)

£108.5m down the drain? Will Hojlund or Zirkzee score again?

Gyokeres will be available for less than that next year. Haaland's fee was a knockdown £52m. Isak cost Newcastle £63m in 2022 - the fee Gyokeres is likely to go for in 2025.

Dan Ashworth was the sporting director at Newcastle when Isak arrived from Real Sociedad. Chris Wood, ousted by Isak, has got four times as many club goals as Hojlund this term.

It is easier for United to clear the decks elsewhere. Their central defensive department could be halved come July 1. Jonny Evans and Victor Lindelof will be out of contract and so will Harry Maguire unless United trigger the one-year options in his deal.

That requires careful consideration. Maguire has played in nine of United's 19 games and has been sidelined for more than seven weeks with a calf problem. Maguire missed 17 games through injury last season, too.

  

![Image 5: Maguire has not played since the goalless draw with Villa](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30235894.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2177084621.jpg)

Maguire has not played since the goalless draw with Villa (Image: Michael Regan/Getty Images.)

United only triggered the one-year option in Lindelof's contract in December with the intention of selling him. Only Lindelof continued to be injury-prone and became unsellable, so United were saddled with him. The Swede is injured again.

Christian Eriksen's hitherto respectable campaign (primarily in cup games) is not cause to retain him beyond his June 30 expiry date. So Lindelof, Eriksen and Jonny Evans (who turns 37 in January) should be three certainties to go in the summer. That is the best part of £400,000 off the wage bill.

Then United have to target some bigger hitters. Casemiro could be more sellable, Antony has the makings of a season-long loan with an option or obligation to buy and Zirkzee is a dud. Hojlund, as a substitute or rotational striker to support a prolific marksman, would have merit.

  

![Image 6: Gyokeres: still scoring for Sporting](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30446108.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185448934.jpg)

Gyokeres: still scoring for Sporting

United will bank £20m or £25m next year when Chelsea are obliged to pay for the services of the flaky Jadon Sancho. A fit and firing left wing back is essential, so Tyrell Malacia or Luke Shaw have to go.

If United want to restore a best-in-class culture then they'll have to be ruthless. Mason Mount emerged for a nothing cameo at Ipswich, did nothing yet posted three pictures of himself onto his Instagram Stories. What kind of a mentality is that?

Marcus Rashford seemed to think a goal after 80 seconds accounted for 90 minutes of work. Rashford is a stop-gap striker for Amorim, who requires an upgrade. But money is tight.

Money is so tight at Manchester United when Erik ten Hag wanted to revert to overnight stays at a nearby hotel before home games last season, he was informed the money was not there.

United restored a players' lounge at Old Trafford at the start of last season at Ten Hag's request. That no imagery of the pre-match hub has ever been published tells its own story.

Ten Hag ended United's seasonal stays at The Lowry Hotel in 2022 but he felt he could exert greater control and foster better team-bonding back at the city centre hotel, with the Hyatt Regency a possible alternative. Ten Hag was overruled.

So the prospect of United spending in the January transfer window is currently remote. They have a 28-man squad and are doubled up in every position. Triple in some. United have six senior centre backs on their books and Leny Yoro has still not had a competitive kick.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

If Ruben Amorim is to have any backing in the mid-season market, United have to sell to buy. Or loan. No club worth their salt is going to part with cash for Antony (one start all season - against League One Barnsley) or Joshua Zirkzee (one goal in 18 games). United could not even obtain a decent fee from a Saudi Pro League club when Al Nassr took Alex Telles off their hands.

Senior figures at United privately feel Zirkzee is a lost cause. United will need a proven goalscorer next year and someone has to make way.

There is that scene in _Moneyball_ where Brad Pitt and Jonah Hill discuss cutting a player. "They're professional ball players, be straight with them. No fluff, just facts," Pitt says. "Would you rather get a bullet to the head or five to the chest and bleed to death?" Watching Zirkzee on Sunday, his United career is becoming death by a thousand cuts. United have to cut him loose.

Amorim actually had to tell Zirkzee, purportedly a striker, to get into the box in the 93rd minute. "At the end of the game we are around the box with two strikers, Josh has to understand that he has to go into the box for the crosses," Amorim bluntly said.

It was easy to surmise Amorim would not be content with Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund as his striker options. Then he benched the £108.5million duo at Ipswich.

United are the punchline again. Norway and Sweden produce brilliant forwards in Erling Haaland, Alexander Isak and Viktor Gyokeres. Which one do United sign? The Danish one. For £72m.

  

![Image 4: £108.5m down the drain? Will Hojlund or Zirkzee score again?](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30291397.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2181992216.jpg)

£108.5m down the drain? Will Hojlund or Zirkzee score again?

Gyokeres will be available for less than that next year. Haaland's fee was a knockdown £52m. Isak cost Newcastle £63m in 2022 - the fee Gyokeres is likely to go for in 2025.

Dan Ashworth was the sporting director at Newcastle when Isak arrived from Real Sociedad. Chris Wood, ousted by Isak, has got four times as many club goals as Hojlund this term.

It is easier for United to clear the decks elsewhere. Their central defensive department could be halved come July 1. Jonny Evans and Victor Lindelof will be out of contract and so will Harry Maguire unless United trigger the one-year options in his deal.

That requires careful consideration. Maguire has played in nine of United's 19 games and has been sidelined for more than seven weeks with a calf problem. Maguire missed 17 games through injury last season, too.

  

![Image 5: Maguire has not played since the goalless draw with Villa](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30235894.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2177084621.jpg)

Maguire has not played since the goalless draw with Villa (Image: Michael Regan/Getty Images.)

United only triggered the one-year option in Lindelof's contract in December with the intention of selling him. Only Lindelof continued to be injury-prone and became unsellable, so United were saddled with him. The Swede is injured again.

Christian Eriksen's hitherto respectable campaign (primarily in cup games) is not cause to retain him beyond his June 30 expiry date. So Lindelof, Eriksen and Jonny Evans (who turns 37 in January) should be three certainties to go in the summer. That is the best part of £400,000 off the wage bill.

Then United have to target some bigger hitters. Casemiro could be more sellable, Antony has the makings of a season-long loan with an option or obligation to buy and Zirkzee is a dud. Hojlund, as a substitute or rotational striker to support a prolific marksman, would have merit.

  

![Image 6: Gyokeres: still scoring for Sporting](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30446108.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185448934.jpg)

Gyokeres: still scoring for Sporting

United will bank £20m or £25m next year when Chelsea are obliged to pay for the services of the flaky Jadon Sancho. A fit and firing left wing back is essential, so Tyrell Malacia or Luke Shaw have to go.

If United want to restore a best-in-class culture then they'll have to be ruthless. Mason Mount emerged for a nothing cameo at Ipswich, did nothing yet posted three pictures of himself onto his Instagram Stories. What kind of a mentality is that?

Marcus Rashford seemed to think a goal after 80 seconds accounted for 90 minutes of work. Rashford is a stop-gap striker for Amorim, who requires an upgrade. But money is tight.

data: {"title":"Manchester United can start their Amorim rebuild by releasing three players","description":"Conclusions can be made on a host of necessary outgoings at Man United next year. At least three players should be all but certain to go.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109","content":"Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players - Samuel Luckhurst - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United can start their Ruben Amorim rebuild by releasing three players
=================================================================================

Conclusions can be made on a host of necessary outgoings at Man United next year. At least three players should be all but certain to go.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments2](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   06:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Amorim needs a consistent scorer like Gyokeres](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30446291.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2176489471.jpg)

Amorim needs a consistent scorer like Gyokeres

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Money is so tight at Manchester United when Erik ten Hag wanted to revert to overnight stays at a nearby hotel before home games last season, he was informed the money was not there.

United restored a players' lounge at Old Trafford at the start of last season at Ten Hag's request. That no imagery of the pre-match hub has ever been published tells its own story.

Ten Hag ended United's seasonal stays at The Lowry Hotel in 2022 but he felt he could exert greater control and foster better team-bonding back at the city centre hotel, with the Hyatt Regency a possible alternative. Ten Hag was overruled.

So the prospect of United spending in the January transfer window is currently remote. They have a 28-man squad and are doubled up in every position. Triple in some. United have six senior centre backs on their books and Leny Yoro has still not had a competitive kick.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

If Ruben Amorim is to have any backing in the mid-season market, United have to sell to buy. Or loan. No club worth their salt is going to part with cash for Antony (one start all season - against League One Barnsley) or Joshua Zirkzee (one goal in 18 games). United could not even obtain a decent fee from a Saudi Pro League club when Al Nassr took Alex Telles off their hands.

Senior figures at United privately feel Zirkzee is a lost cause. United will need a proven goalscorer next year and someone has to make way.

There is that scene in _Moneyball_ where Brad Pitt and Jonah Hill discuss cutting a player. "They're professional ball players, be straight with them. No fluff, just facts," Pitt says. "Would you rather get a bullet to the head or five to the chest and bleed to death?" Watching Zirkzee on Sunday, his United career is becoming death by a thousand cuts. United have to cut him loose.

Amorim actually had to tell Zirkzee, purportedly a striker, to get into the box in the 93rd minute. "At the end of the game we are around the box with two strikers, Josh has to understand that he has to go into the box for the crosses," Amorim bluntly said.

It was easy to surmise Amorim would not be content with Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund as his striker options. Then he benched the £108.5million duo at Ipswich.

United are the punchline again. Norway and Sweden produce brilliant forwards in Erling Haaland, Alexander Isak and Viktor Gyokeres. Which one do United sign? The Danish one. For £72m.

  

![Image 4: £108.5m down the drain? Will Hojlund or Zirkzee score again?](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30291397.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2181992216.jpg)

£108.5m down the drain? Will Hojlund or Zirkzee score again?

Gyokeres will be available for less than that next year. Haaland's fee was a knockdown £52m. Isak cost Newcastle £63m in 2022 - the fee Gyokeres is likely to go for in 2025.

Dan Ashworth was the sporting director at Newcastle when Isak arrived from Real Sociedad. Chris Wood, ousted by Isak, has got four times as many club goals as Hojlund this term.

It is easier for United to clear the decks elsewhere. Their central defensive department could be halved come July 1. Jonny Evans and Victor Lindelof will be out of contract and so will Harry Maguire unless United trigger the one-year options in his deal.

That requires careful consideration. Maguire has played in nine of United's 19 games and has been sidelined for more than seven weeks with a calf problem. Maguire missed 17 games through injury last season, too.

  

![Image 5: Maguire has not played since the goalless draw with Villa](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30235894.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2177084621.jpg)

Maguire has not played since the goalless draw with Villa (Image: Michael Regan/Getty Images.)

United only triggered the one-year option in Lindelof's contract in December with the intention of selling him. Only Lindelof continued to be injury-prone and became unsellable, so United were saddled with him. The Swede is injured again.

Christian Eriksen's hitherto respectable campaign (primarily in cup games) is not cause to retain him beyond his June 30 expiry date. So Lindelof, Eriksen and Jonny Evans (who turns 37 in January) should be three certainties to go in the summer. That is the best part of £400,000 off the wage bill.

Then United have to target some bigger hitters. Casemiro could be more sellable, Antony has the makings of a season-long loan with an option or obligation to buy and Zirkzee is a dud. Hojlund, as a substitute or rotational striker to support a prolific marksman, would have merit.

  

![Image 6: Gyokeres: still scoring for Sporting](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30446108.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185448934.jpg)

Gyokeres: still scoring for Sporting

United will bank £20m or £25m next year when Chelsea are obliged to pay for the services of the flaky Jadon Sancho. A fit and firing left wing back is essential, so Tyrell Malacia or Luke Shaw have to go.

If United want to restore a best-in-class culture then they'll have to be ruthless. Mason Mount emerged for a nothing cameo at Ipswich, did nothing yet posted three pictures of himself onto his Instagram Stories. What kind of a mentality is that?

Marcus Rashford seemed to think a goal after 80 seconds accounted for 90 minutes of work. Rashford is a stop-gap striker for Amorim, who requires an upgrade. But money is tight.

Sergio Aguero says Alejandro Garnacho has the right mentors to learn from at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) as he tipped the Argentine for a bright future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), hitting back at the winger's detractors in a blunt message.

The 20-year-old, who signed from Atletico Madrid in 2020, made his 105th appearance for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in Sunday's draw at Ipswich Town, [which was Ruben Amorim's first game as head coach](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823).

The Portuguese tactician is the fourth coach Garnacho has worked with at Old Trafford after being handed his debut by Ralf Rangnick in April 2022 before enjoying a breakthrough 2022/23 campaign under Erik ten Hag. In the time between the sacking of Ten Hag and the arrival of Amorim, Garnacho started three of the four games during Ruud van Nistelrooy's time as interim manager.

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

**READ MORE:** [**'Stuck' - Amorim reveals the new instructions United players have**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/stuck-ruben-amorim-explains-what-30441804)

Despite putting up such impressive numbers during his two-and-a-half years in the United first-team, Garnacho has taken a fair bit of flack this season for some of his recent performances, especially during the back end of Ten Hag's time at the club.

However, Aguero believes his compatriot is unfairly criticised at times and, in fact, many of his detractors forget just how old Garnacho actually is.

Speaking to [Stake.com](http://stake.com/), five-time [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) winner Aguero said: "Sometimes, people forget how young Alejandro is. His raw talent got him to the Premier League at a young age, and he's proven his worth already.

"I've seen many of his teammates leaning in to help him develop as a pro player, and that's massive. If he has that type of mentorship, I'm sure there's a bright future ahead of him."

Garnacho played 86 minutes at Portman Road on Sunday afternoon as he was used in an attacking midfield role by Amorim.

Sergio Aguero makes Man United prediction about Alejandro Garnacho in blunt message
===================================================================================

Alejandro Garnacho has become a key player for Manchester United since making his debut in April 2022
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho has been on the receiving end of some criticism this season

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Sergio Aguero says Alejandro Garnacho has the right mentors to learn from at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) as he tipped the Argentine for a bright future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), hitting back at the winger's detractors in a blunt message.

The 20-year-old, who signed from Atletico Madrid in 2020, made his 105th appearance for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in Sunday's draw at Ipswich Town, [which was Ruben Amorim's first game as head coach](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823).

The Portuguese tactician is the fourth coach Garnacho has worked with at Old Trafford after being handed his debut by Ralf Rangnick in April 2022 before enjoying a breakthrough 2022/23 campaign under Erik ten Hag. In the time between the sacking of Ten Hag and the arrival of Amorim, Garnacho started three of the four games during Ruud van Nistelrooy's time as interim manager.

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

**READ MORE:** [**'Stuck' - Amorim reveals the new instructions United players have**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/stuck-ruben-amorim-explains-what-30441804)

Despite putting up such impressive numbers during his two-and-a-half years in the United first-team, Garnacho has taken a fair bit of flack this season for some of his recent performances, especially during the back end of Ten Hag's time at the club.

However, Aguero believes his compatriot is unfairly criticised at times and, in fact, many of his detractors forget just how old Garnacho actually is.

Speaking to [Stake.com](http://stake.com/), five-time [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) winner Aguero said: "Sometimes, people forget how young Alejandro is. His raw talent got him to the Premier League at a young age, and he's proven his worth already.

"I've seen many of his teammates leaning in to help him develop as a pro player, and that's massive. If he has that type of mentorship, I'm sure there's a bright future ahead of him."

Garnacho played 86 minutes at Portman Road on Sunday afternoon as he was used in an attacking midfield role by Amorim.

data: {"title":"Sergio Aguero makes prediction about Alejandro Garnacho in blunt United message","description":"Alejandro Garnacho has become a key player for Manchester United since making his debut in April 2022","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sergio-aguero-makes-man-united-30445126","content":"Sergio Aguero makes Man United prediction about Alejandro Garnacho in blunt message - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Sergio Aguero makes Man United prediction about Alejandro Garnacho in blunt message
===================================================================================

Alejandro Garnacho has become a key player for Manchester United since making his debut in April 2022
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments6](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sergio-aguero-makes-man-united-30445126#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Keifer MacDonald](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/keifer-macdonald/)

*   12:30, 25 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho has been on the receiving end of some criticism this season](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30441359.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186655445.jpg)

Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho has been on the receiving end of some criticism this season

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Sergio Aguero says Alejandro Garnacho has the right mentors to learn from at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) as he tipped the Argentine for a bright future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), hitting back at the winger's detractors in a blunt message.

The 20-year-old, who signed from Atletico Madrid in 2020, made his 105th appearance for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in Sunday's draw at Ipswich Town, [which was Ruben Amorim's first game as head coach](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823).

The Portuguese tactician is the fourth coach Garnacho has worked with at Old Trafford after being handed his debut by Ralf Rangnick in April 2022 before enjoying a breakthrough 2022/23 campaign under Erik ten Hag. In the time between the sacking of Ten Hag and the arrival of Amorim, Garnacho started three of the four games during Ruud van Nistelrooy's time as interim manager.

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

**READ MORE:** [**'Stuck' - Amorim reveals the new instructions United players have**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/stuck-ruben-amorim-explains-what-30441804)

Despite putting up such impressive numbers during his two-and-a-half years in the United first-team, Garnacho has taken a fair bit of flack this season for some of his recent performances, especially during the back end of Ten Hag's time at the club.

However, Aguero believes his compatriot is unfairly criticised at times and, in fact, many of his detractors forget just how old Garnacho actually is.

Speaking to [Stake.com](http://stake.com/), five-time [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) winner Aguero said: "Sometimes, people forget how young Alejandro is. His raw talent got him to the Premier League at a young age, and he's proven his worth already.

"I've seen many of his teammates leaning in to help him develop as a pro player, and that's massive. If he has that type of mentorship, I'm sure there's a bright future ahead of him."

Garnacho played 86 minutes at Portman Road on Sunday afternoon as he was used in an attacking midfield role by Amorim.

data: {"title":"Sergio Aguero makes prediction about Alejandro Garnacho in blunt United message","description":"Alejandro Garnacho has become a key player for Manchester United since making his debut in April 2022","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sergio-aguero-makes-man-united-30445126","content":"Sergio Aguero makes Man United prediction about Alejandro Garnacho in blunt message - Manchester Evening News
===============

Sergio Aguero makes Man United prediction about Alejandro Garnacho in blunt message
===================================================================================

Alejandro Garnacho has become a key player for Manchester United since making his debut in April 2022
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments6](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sergio-aguero-makes-man-united-30445126#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Keifer MacDonald](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/keifer-macdonald/)

*   12:30, 25 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho has been on the receiving end of some criticism this season](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30441359.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186655445.jpg)

Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho has been on the receiving end of some criticism this season

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Sergio Aguero says Alejandro Garnacho has the right mentors to learn from at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) as he tipped the Argentine for a bright future at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), hitting back at the winger's detractors in a blunt message.

The 20-year-old, who signed from Atletico Madrid in 2020, made his 105th appearance for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in Sunday's draw at Ipswich Town, [which was Ruben Amorim's first game as head coach](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823).

The Portuguese tactician is the fourth coach Garnacho has worked with at Old Trafford after being handed his debut by Ralf Rangnick in April 2022 before enjoying a breakthrough 2022/23 campaign under Erik ten Hag. In the time between the sacking of Ten Hag and the arrival of Amorim, Garnacho started three of the four games during Ruud van Nistelrooy's time as interim manager.

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

**READ MORE:** [**'Stuck' - Amorim reveals the new instructions United players have**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/stuck-ruben-amorim-explains-what-30441804)

Despite putting up such impressive numbers during his two-and-a-half years in the United first-team, Garnacho has taken a fair bit of flack this season for some of his recent performances, especially during the back end of Ten Hag's time at the club.

However, Aguero believes his compatriot is unfairly criticised at times and, in fact, many of his detractors forget just how old Garnacho actually is.

Speaking to [Stake.com](http://stake.com/), five-time [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) winner Aguero said: "Sometimes, people forget how young Alejandro is. His raw talent got him to the Premier League at a young age, and he's proven his worth already.

"I've seen many of his teammates leaning in to help him develop as a pro player, and that's massive. If he has that type of mentorship, I'm sure there's a bright future ahead of him."

Garnacho played 86 minutes at Portman Road on Sunday afternoon as he was used in an attacking midfield role by Amorim.

data: {"title":"Jamie Carragher slams Mo Salah and reveals the key reason he is 'disappointed' with the Liverpool star","description":"The former Liverpool defender was speaking on Sky Sports' MNF","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-jamie-carragher-475131-20241125","content":"Jamie Carragher slams Mo Salah and reveals the key reason he is 'disappointed' with the Liverpool star - Champions League - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Jamie Carragher explained how he is ‘disappointed’ by Mo Salah following the Egyptian’s comments after Liverpool’s 3-2 win at Southampton on Sunday.**

[Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/premier-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-virgil-van-dijk-reaction-762932-20241125), 32, scored a brace to help the Reds go eight points clear of second-place [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) in the race for the Premier League.

However, it was [Salah’s comments](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-contract-negotiations-207279-20241125) he made to reporters waiting in the ‘mixed zone’ that really made the headlines after full-time.

Advert

The Egyptian discussed his future with the gathered press pack.

"We are almost in December, and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club,” said Salah outside the Players Entrance at St Mary’s.

"I'm probably more out than in,” he admitted.

Advert

When reporters then questioned if he was disappointed by the current situation, the forward replied, “Of course”.

"I'm not going to retire soon, so I'm just playing, focusing on the season, and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well,” he added.

“I'm disappointed, but we will see."

![Image 1: Mo Salah scored a brace at Southampton on Sunday (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltd197cab496aef1bd/6744d20075374d757380e05f/GettyImages-2186779466.jpg)

Mo Salah scored a brace at Southampton on Sunday (Credit:Getty)

Advert

Salah has been fairly open about his situation and addressed the situation after Liverpool’s 3-0 win away against Manchester United On September 1.

On that occasion, he revealed that it could be his last year at Liverpool and that it was “up to the club” regarding his future.

The goalscorer is one of three Liverpool players whose contracts are set to expire this summer, with [Virgil van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/virgil-van-dijk) and [Trent Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/football/premier-league/liverpool-trent-alexanderarnold-england-630725-20241119)’s futures still uncertain.

“I must say, I am very disappointed with Mo Salah,” Carragher said on [Sky Sports’ MNF.](https://x.com/SkySportsPL/status/1861122528883691772)

Advert

“\[With\] that interview yesterday…Liverpool have got Real Madrid midweek and Manchester City at the weekend – that’s the story for Liverpool right now.

“And Mo Salah, we’re all quite aware…that in the seven years he has been at the football club, he’s stopped in the mixed zone twice, which is his right, which is absolutely fine.

“But he decided to stop for the third time away at Southampton on the back of winning Liverpool the game.”

The former Liverpool defender admitted earlier in the show that he was “desperate” for the player and club to “meet in the middle” regarding Salah’s contract demands.

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

**Jamie Carragher explained how he is ‘disappointed’ by Mo Salah following the Egyptian’s comments after Liverpool’s 3-2 win at Southampton on Sunday.**

[Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/premier-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-virgil-van-dijk-reaction-762932-20241125), 32, scored a brace to help the Reds go eight points clear of second-place [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) in the race for the Premier League.

However, it was [Salah’s comments](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-contract-negotiations-207279-20241125) he made to reporters waiting in the ‘mixed zone’ that really made the headlines after full-time.

Advert

The Egyptian discussed his future with the gathered press pack.

"We are almost in December, and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club,” said Salah outside the Players Entrance at St Mary’s.

"I'm probably more out than in,” he admitted.

Advert

When reporters then questioned if he was disappointed by the current situation, the forward replied, “Of course”.

"I'm not going to retire soon, so I'm just playing, focusing on the season, and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well,” he added.

“I'm disappointed, but we will see."

![Image 1: Mo Salah scored a brace at Southampton on Sunday (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltd197cab496aef1bd/6744d20075374d757380e05f/GettyImages-2186779466.jpg)

Mo Salah scored a brace at Southampton on Sunday (Credit:Getty)

Advert

Salah has been fairly open about his situation and addressed the situation after Liverpool’s 3-0 win away against Manchester United On September 1.

On that occasion, he revealed that it could be his last year at Liverpool and that it was “up to the club” regarding his future.

The goalscorer is one of three Liverpool players whose contracts are set to expire this summer, with [Virgil van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/virgil-van-dijk) and [Trent Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/football/premier-league/liverpool-trent-alexanderarnold-england-630725-20241119)’s futures still uncertain.

“I must say, I am very disappointed with Mo Salah,” Carragher said on [Sky Sports’ MNF.](https://x.com/SkySportsPL/status/1861122528883691772)

Advert

“\[With\] that interview yesterday…Liverpool have got Real Madrid midweek and Manchester City at the weekend – that’s the story for Liverpool right now.

“And Mo Salah, we’re all quite aware…that in the seven years he has been at the football club, he’s stopped in the mixed zone twice, which is his right, which is absolutely fine.

“But he decided to stop for the third time away at Southampton on the back of winning Liverpool the game.”

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Not nowOK

**New footage has emerged showing exactly what Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk did when he saw Mo Salah speaking to the media.**

[Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-transfer-news-contract-update-major-frontrunners-079380-20241125), 32, scored twice in the 3-2 victory at St Mary’s as the Reds went eight points clear of [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) at the top of the Premier League.

The brace took his tally to ten goals and six assists in just twelve league games this term.

Advert

But it was [Salah’s post-match comments](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-contract-negotiations-207279-20241125) that hit the headlines following the result.

The forward admitted that he was “probably more out than in” when discussing whether he had been offered a new contract by the club.

Salah is just one of three of Liverpool’s key players whose contract is set to expire following the 2024/25 campaign - with [Trent Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/trent-alexander-arnold) and [Van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/virgil-van-dijk)’s futures still uncertain.

Advert

The latter of the trio, who featured against his former side on Sunday, could not help but react when he saw Salah speaking to the media scrum outside the Players Entrance at St Mary’s.

While the Egyptian was voicing his thoughts to the gathered journalists, Van Dijk slowly walked towards him before smirking and catching Salah’s eye, who also appeared to find the situation amusing.

Fans on social were quick to give their thoughts on Van Dijk’s reaction.

Advert

One said: “Mo's body language became more unsettled once VVD showed up, and he became aware of it. Almost like he got caught doing something he shouldn't have, haha.”

A second added: “What a mess so far by LFC. Poor summer window signing a crocked winger and a keeper when we have two of the best.

“Failure to get a midfielder and now on the cusp of losing club legends. No contract will outweigh the cost of replacement and the drop in output. Get it done!”

With a third saying: “If Mo, Virgil and Trent leave, it’ll be extremely embarrassing and disastrous to FSG. Everything at Liverpool is going through these players. Can’t afford to lose even one of them.”

Advert

While a fourth exclaimed: “I think Virg knows something might be coming up. No way our captain isn't in on it.”

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**New footage has emerged showing exactly what Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk did when he saw Mo Salah speaking to the media.**

[Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-transfer-news-contract-update-major-frontrunners-079380-20241125), 32, scored twice in the 3-2 victory at St Mary’s as the Reds went eight points clear of [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) at the top of the Premier League.

The brace took his tally to ten goals and six assists in just twelve league games this term.

Advert

But it was [Salah’s post-match comments](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-contract-negotiations-207279-20241125) that hit the headlines following the result.

The forward admitted that he was “probably more out than in” when discussing whether he had been offered a new contract by the club.

Salah is just one of three of Liverpool’s key players whose contract is set to expire following the 2024/25 campaign - with [Trent Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/trent-alexander-arnold) and [Van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/virgil-van-dijk)’s futures still uncertain.

Advert

The latter of the trio, who featured against his former side on Sunday, could not help but react when he saw Salah speaking to the media scrum outside the Players Entrance at St Mary’s.

While the Egyptian was voicing his thoughts to the gathered journalists, Van Dijk slowly walked towards him before smirking and catching Salah’s eye, who also appeared to find the situation amusing.

Fans on social were quick to give their thoughts on Van Dijk’s reaction.

Advert

One said: “Mo's body language became more unsettled once VVD showed up, and he became aware of it. Almost like he got caught doing something he shouldn't have, haha.”

A second added: “What a mess so far by LFC. Poor summer window signing a crocked winger and a keeper when we have two of the best.

“Failure to get a midfielder and now on the cusp of losing club legends. No contract will outweigh the cost of replacement and the drop in output. Get it done!”

With a third saying: “If Mo, Virgil and Trent leave, it’ll be extremely embarrassing and disastrous to FSG. Everything at Liverpool is going through these players. Can’t afford to lose even one of them.”

Advert

While a fourth exclaimed: “I think Virg knows something might be coming up. No way our captain isn't in on it.”

data: {"title":"Jamie Carragher reveals the 'issue' between Liverpool and Mo Salah as contract talks continue to stall","description":"The former Liverpool defender gave his take","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-mo-salah-jamie-carragher-contract-mnf-429874-20241125","content":"Jamie Carragher reveals the 'issue' between Liverpool and Mo Salah as contract talks continue to stall - Liverpool - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Jamie Carragher has revealed what he thinks the 'issue' between Liverpool and Mo Salah is regarding his contract situation.**

Salah, 32, scored twice at St Mary’s to help Liverpool go eight points clear at the top of the Premier League.

However, after the game, he spoke to journalists gathered in the mixed zone regarding his future.

Advert

"We are almost in December, and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club,” Salah said.

“I'm probably more out than in.

"You know I have been in the club for many years. There is no club like this. But in the end, it is not in my hands.

“As I said, it is December, and I haven't received anything yet about my future.

Advert

"I love the fans. The fans love me. In the end, it is not in my hands or the fans' hands."

He also went on to admit he felt “disappointed” by the situation.

This prompted Sky Sports’ pundit Carragher to voice how he was in fact, [disappointed at Salah’s timing](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-jamie-carragher-475131-20241125) given the fact Liverpool face Real Madrid and Manchester City this week.

“I must say, I am very disappointed with Mo Salah,” Carragher said on [Sky Sports’ MNF.](https://x.com/SkySportsPL/status/1861122528883691772)

Advert

![Image 1: Jamie Carragher seemingly changed his mind (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltbd8cb43106e7d09f/6744f3f920f044cd5f8f42a5/GettyImages-2186615584.jpg)

Jamie Carragher seemingly changed his mind (Credit:Getty)

“\[With\] that interview yesterday…Liverpool have got Real Madrid midweek and Manchester City at the weekend – that’s the story for Liverpool right now.

“And Mo Salah, we’re all quite aware…that in the seven years he has been at the football club, he’s stopped in the mixed zone twice, which is his right, which is absolutely fine.

“But he decided to stop for the third time away at Southampton on the back of winning Liverpool the game.”

Advert

However, Carragher had seemingly given a less harsh view of the situation earlier in the broadcast and gave a considered take on what he felt the issue between both parties is.

"I think it's pretty obvious what the issue is what Mo Salah feels he's worth, whether that's in financial terms or length of contract is completely different to what Liverpool feel at this moment," explained Carragher.

"I just hope they meet somewhere in the middle at some stage between now and the end of the season, as I'm desperate to see him in a Liverpool shirt next season."

data: {"title":"Jamie Carragher reveals the 'issue' between Liverpool and Mo Salah as contract talks continue to stall","description":"The former Liverpool defender gave his take","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-mo-salah-jamie-carragher-contract-mnf-429874-20241125","content":"Jamie Carragher reveals the 'issue' between Liverpool and Mo Salah as contract talks continue to stall - Liverpool - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Jamie Carragher has revealed what he thinks the 'issue' between Liverpool and Mo Salah is regarding his contract situation.**

Salah, 32, scored twice at St Mary’s to help Liverpool go eight points clear at the top of the Premier League.

However, after the game, he spoke to journalists gathered in the mixed zone regarding his future.

Advert

"We are almost in December, and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club,” Salah said.

“I'm probably more out than in.

"You know I have been in the club for many years. There is no club like this. But in the end, it is not in my hands.

“As I said, it is December, and I haven't received anything yet about my future.

Advert

"I love the fans. The fans love me. In the end, it is not in my hands or the fans' hands."

He also went on to admit he felt “disappointed” by the situation.

This prompted Sky Sports’ pundit Carragher to voice how he was in fact, [disappointed at Salah’s timing](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-jamie-carragher-475131-20241125) given the fact Liverpool face Real Madrid and Manchester City this week.

“I must say, I am very disappointed with Mo Salah,” Carragher said on [Sky Sports’ MNF.](https://x.com/SkySportsPL/status/1861122528883691772)

Advert

![Image 1: Jamie Carragher seemingly changed his mind (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltbd8cb43106e7d09f/6744f3f920f044cd5f8f42a5/GettyImages-2186615584.jpg)

Jamie Carragher seemingly changed his mind (Credit:Getty)

“\[With\] that interview yesterday…Liverpool have got Real Madrid midweek and Manchester City at the weekend – that’s the story for Liverpool right now.

“And Mo Salah, we’re all quite aware…that in the seven years he has been at the football club, he’s stopped in the mixed zone twice, which is his right, which is absolutely fine.

“But he decided to stop for the third time away at Southampton on the back of winning Liverpool the game.”

Advert

However, Carragher had seemingly given a less harsh view of the situation earlier in the broadcast and gave a considered take on what he felt the issue between both parties is.

"I think it's pretty obvious what the issue is what Mo Salah feels he's worth, whether that's in financial terms or length of contract is completely different to what Liverpool feel at this moment," explained Carragher.

"I just hope they meet somewhere in the middle at some stage between now and the end of the season, as I'm desperate to see him in a Liverpool shirt next season."

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

data: {"title":"Arne Slot has bizarre superstition he sticks to every Liverpool matchday to avoid bad luck","description":"The Liverpool boss has a unique matchday ritual","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-arne-slot-superstition-519356-20241125","content":"Arne Slot has bizarre superstition he sticks to every Liverpool matchday to avoid bad luck - Champions League - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has a ritual he follows on matchdays, according to reports.**

[Slot](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/arne-slot-jurgen-klopp-038623-20241004), 46, took charge of the Reds in June 2024 following Jurgen Klopp’s departure.

Given the fact he had come from the Eredivisie, both fans and the British media were unsure how he would take to life as a Premier League boss.

Advert

But even the most optimistic of [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) fans could not have predicted his start to life at Anfield.

A [Mohamed Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-jamie-carragher-475131-20241125) brace saw the Reds to a 3-2 comeback victory against Southampton at St Mary’s on Sunday.

The win meant Slot’s side went eight points clear of second place [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) in the Premier League table.

Advert

They currently sit top of the 36-team Champions League table with a perfect four wins from four games so far this term.

Of course, Slot’s tactics, Liverpool’s players and even the Anfield atmosphere could all be contributing factors to their success, but there may be a more alternative reason at play.

According to [Mail Sport](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-14115185/Arne-Slot-LEWIS-STEELE-flying-Dutchman-Liverpool-Jurgen-Klopp.html?ns_mchannel=rss&ito=1490&ns_campaign=1490&utm_medium=facebook&utm_campaign=auto-liverpool&utm_source=social), the Dutchman has a superstition which involves avoiding looking at the clock at exactly 13.13 (1:13 or am) for several years, as he believes the number can mean bad luck.

And luckily for Slot, Liverpool don’t have a ‘13’ in their official squad list.

Advert

But he is not the only football manager to have fairly odd superstitions.

![Image 1: Arne Slot has a unique matchday ritual (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltc2915f7ae5495b12/6744ddb795f3d8d1e7453abc/GettyImages-2186644012.jpg)

Arne Slot has a unique matchday ritual (Credit:Getty)

Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone is thought to be [keen on routines](https://www.sportbible.com/football/diego-simeone-is-the-most-superstitious-coach-in-football-history-20220407) which could also pass as superstitions.

Guilherme Siqueira, who played for the La Liga outfit from 2014 to 2017, revealed that the Argentine had the same music playlist on the team coach and in the changing room ahead of games.

Advert

“Atleti have the most superstitious coaching staff I have seen in the history of football, I have never seen anything like it,” Siqueira told _ESPN Brasil,_ via [Squawka](https://www.squawka.com/en/diego-simeone-superstitious-atletico-madrid-guilherme-siqueira/) in December 2021.

In recent times, Slot’s Merseyside rival Everton boss Sean Dyche even switched up his choice of clothing on matchday.

Dyche was known for his long-sleeved white shirt and blue tie.

But during a relegation ‘six-pointer’ against Nottingham Forest in April 2024, the Toffees’ boss wore a club tracksuit to the surprise of many.

Advert

Strangely enough, his side won 2-0. So, the tracksuit stayed. And the coincidence did not stop there as his team went on a fine run of form, beating city rivals Liverpool and Brentford in a six-day period to ensure their Premier League status.

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has a ritual he follows on matchdays, according to reports.**

[Slot](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/arne-slot-jurgen-klopp-038623-20241004), 46, took charge of the Reds in June 2024 following Jurgen Klopp’s departure.

Given the fact he had come from the Eredivisie, both fans and the British media were unsure how he would take to life as a Premier League boss.

Advert

But even the most optimistic of [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) fans could not have predicted his start to life at Anfield.

A [Mohamed Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-jamie-carragher-475131-20241125) brace saw the Reds to a 3-2 comeback victory against Southampton at St Mary’s on Sunday.

The win meant Slot’s side went eight points clear of second place [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) in the Premier League table.

Advert

They currently sit top of the 36-team Champions League table with a perfect four wins from four games so far this term.

Of course, Slot’s tactics, Liverpool’s players and even the Anfield atmosphere could all be contributing factors to their success, but there may be a more alternative reason at play.

According to [Mail Sport](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-14115185/Arne-Slot-LEWIS-STEELE-flying-Dutchman-Liverpool-Jurgen-Klopp.html?ns_mchannel=rss&ito=1490&ns_campaign=1490&utm_medium=facebook&utm_campaign=auto-liverpool&utm_source=social), the Dutchman has a superstition which involves avoiding looking at the clock at exactly 13.13 (1:13 or am) for several years, as he believes the number can mean bad luck.

And luckily for Slot, Liverpool don’t have a ‘13’ in their official squad list.

Advert

But he is not the only football manager to have fairly odd superstitions.

![Image 1: Arne Slot has a unique matchday ritual (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltc2915f7ae5495b12/6744ddb795f3d8d1e7453abc/GettyImages-2186644012.jpg)

Arne Slot has a unique matchday ritual (Credit:Getty)

Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone is thought to be [keen on routines](https://www.sportbible.com/football/diego-simeone-is-the-most-superstitious-coach-in-football-history-20220407) which could also pass as superstitions.

Guilherme Siqueira, who played for the La Liga outfit from 2014 to 2017, revealed that the Argentine had the same music playlist on the team coach and in the changing room ahead of games.

Advert

“Atleti have the most superstitious coaching staff I have seen in the history of football, I have never seen anything like it,” Siqueira told _ESPN Brasil,_ via [Squawka](https://www.squawka.com/en/diego-simeone-superstitious-atletico-madrid-guilherme-siqueira/) in December 2021.

In recent times, Slot’s Merseyside rival Everton boss Sean Dyche even switched up his choice of clothing on matchday.

Dyche was known for his long-sleeved white shirt and blue tie.

But during a relegation ‘six-pointer’ against Nottingham Forest in April 2024, the Toffees’ boss wore a club tracksuit to the surprise of many.

Advert

Strangely enough, his side won 2-0. So, the tracksuit stayed. And the coincidence did not stop there as his team went on a fine run of form, beating city rivals Liverpool and Brentford in a six-day period to ensure their Premier League status.

So maybe there is a method to coach’s rituals after all.

data: {"title":"Portuguese media make their feelings clear on Man Utd after Ruben Amorim held to draw in first match","description":"Portuguese media have spoken out after Ruben Amorim's first match as Manchester United manager against Ipswich Town.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-ipswich-town-portugal-media-reacts-092422-20241125","content":"Portuguese media make their feelings clear on Man Utd after Ruben Amorim held to draw in first match - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Portuguese media have had their say on Ruben Amorim following his first game in charge of new club Manchester United.**

After an exciting 3-2 [match between Liverpool and Southampton on Sunday](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-southampton-arne-slot-336586-20241124), all all eyes turned to the Portman Road Stadium as [Ipswich Town](https://www.sportbible.com/ipswich-town) welcomed [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) to England [for his first game as United manager.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-joshua-zirkzee-man-united-ipswich-026294-20241125)

[Despite an early goal from Marcus Rashford](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-marcus-rashford-goal-ipswich-559633-20241124), [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) allowed the hosts back into the game as Omari Hutchinson scored an equaliser that set the final scoreline as 1-1.

Advert

And in the wake of the match, members of the Portuguese media have spoken out about former Sporting manager Amorim's first match in charge of United.

Portuguese outlet Record was not impressed with what they say from Amorim's side on Sunday suggesting that, while two players enjoyed standout performances, Amorim has a lot that he needs to improve at United.

Their report [stated](https://www.record.pt/jogos-em-direto/live/146800): "The goal after just 2 minutes suggested a great performance from Manchester United in Ruben Amorim's debut, but it was short-lived.

Advert

"Rashford scored after a great play by Diallo, but the Red Devils, in short, put in a somewhat lacklustre performance against an Ipswich side that was better at various points in the game.

"Onana shone on two occasions in the United goal and Bruno Fernandes was the most clear-cut, but Amorim's team struggled to connect the game and lacked intensity.

"Ultimately, the Portuguese coach has a lot of work ahead of him."

Sports newspaper A Bola agreed with Record's assessment and were highly critical of United's performance, criticising their lack of speed and unity.

Advert

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim's first match as Manchester United manager ended as a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town. (Image: Getty) ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltf29b28a58f371f13/674495fef32005d7356c8a6e/GettyImages-2186663264.jpg)

Ruben Amorim's first match as Manchester United manager ended as a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town. (Image: Getty)

They [reported](https://www.abola.pt/futebol/noticias/so-80-segundos-a-amorim-que-o-resto-ainda-foi-a-ten-hag-2024112418431377949): "The first goal of the Amorim era for the Red Devils came just 80 seconds into the game.

"The worst came later: a shapeless team, slow defence, low pace and rare dangerous chances up front, showing that there is still a lot of work ahead for the Portuguese coach."

Amorim's next match in the United dugout will be his first at Old Trafford as his side hosts Norwegian club Bodø/Glimt for a [Europa League](https://www.sportbible.com/europa-league) clash on Thursday night.

Advert

United will then play seven Premier League fixtures in December as part of a busy festive period, the first of which is a home fixture against Everton.

‘Exactly what we need’: Diogo Dalot praises Ruben Amorim’s high demands
=======================================================================

*   Clarity of coach’s messaging also impresses defender
*   He says Amorim’s philosophy suits Manchester United

![Image 3](https://assets.guim.co.uk/static/frontend/logos/red-blue-small-banner-faded.svg)![Image 4](https://assets.guim.co.uk/static/frontend/logos/red-blue-large-banner-faded.svg)

No billionaire approved this
----------------------------

How the Guardian is different

Diogo Dalot believes Ruben Amorim is precisely what [Manchester United](https://www.theguardian.com/football/manchester-united) need as he talked up the clarity of the new head coach’s messaging and his highly demanding nature.

Amorim’s first match was Sunday’s [1-1 draw at Ipswich](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/24/ipswich-manchester-united-premier-league-match-report). Had Erik ten Hag still been in charge, the inquest would have raged because of the level of the performance and the context. Ipswich are in the relegation places. They have not won at home in the Premier League since April 2002.

[First Premier League weekend on Bluesky was nice and soft but X hard-edges remain John Brewin Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/25/first-premier-league-weekend-on-bluesky-was-nice-and-soft-but-x-hard-edges-remain)

As it was, there were mainly shrugs, an acceptance that United have fallen far and the transition to Amorim’s 3-4-2-1 system will take time. He was able to deliver brutal truths without the fear of comeback, specifically the line about how United will have to [“suffer for a long period”](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/24/ruben-amorim-says-manchester-united-will-suffer-after-fast-start-fizzles-out) before their fortunes turn.

It was a day when United had to look hard for the positives, although there was a glimpse of how Amorim wants to attack. When Amad Diallo surged up the right in the second minute, he had three options in the box for the cross. Marcus Rashford made the run to the near post but Alejandro Garnacho and Dalot – having sprinted up from left wing-back – were behind him. Amad picked out Rashford for 1-0.

Dalot sought to highlight what Amorim had brought in the preparations, albeit they were short as a consequence of many of the players being involved with their countries during the international break.

“It’s gone really well,” Dalot said. “He made an impact straight away in terms of his philosophy and the way he wants us to play. It suits the standards of the club – high-intensity football and working hard for the team.

“We have to give credit to him and his staff for all the information they gave us. It was really clear and obviously now we will take some more training sessions and games to put this into practice.

“He’s really demanding. He’s exactly what we need for this type of club. That’s the standard the club should have, by demanding people are really professional and working hard for the team. That’s the clear message that he gives us every day.”

[skip past newsletter promotion](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/25/ruben-amorim-diogo-dalot-high-demands-manchester-united#EmailSignup-skip-link-9)after newsletter promotion

Amorim’s reserves of reputational credit run deep and the United travelling support got behind him at the outset, singing his name to the tune of Give It Up by KC & The Sunshine Band. What frustrated Amorim was how his team surrendered the initiative after Rashford’s goal. The buildup play from the back became jammed, the fluidity missing. United would be indebted to the goalkeeper, André Onana, for three big saves.

“The message he \[Amorim\] gave to everybody was clear – he wants us to have more control of the games,” Dalot said. “And that’s what we want to do. With me \[as the left wing-back\] it was: ‘Sprint back and be really hard-working. Give an option and don’t be afraid to have the ball.’ I felt comfortable. I’ve played on the left a couple of times now and the system is good for this club. I’ve played with three centre-backs before.”

**Subscribe to Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly newsletter from one of the world’s top soccer journalists.**

I’m lucky enough to have been able to turn a childhood soccer obsession into a 24-year career that has included 13 books, regular columns in the best publications in the world and regular namechecks on Ted Lasso.

Now, I’m writing a weekly newsletter about European football aimed at a US audience, and I hope you consider signing up for it. Each week, alongside my regular column in the Observer, the Guardian’s sister Sunday paper, I’ll be looking at the biggest stories from the weekend’s action, along with issues affecting the global game.

Subscribers can expect it in their inbox every Monday. It’s entirely free and quite straightforward to cancel, so why not subscribe now?

Jonathan Wilson
